Header: Thousands attempt to break world record with Indonesian line dance ahead of Asian Games
Content: Thousands of people attempted to break the Guinness World Records with an Indonesian line dance called ‘poco-poco’, ahead of the Asian Games that will kick off later this month. At least 65,000 people lined the 8-km stretch from the National Palace to the business district in southern Jakarta during the weekly car-free day event in capital Jakarta. Participants hope to promote the beauty of Indonesian culture through “poco-poco”, a popular line dance that originated from the eastern Indonesian Sulawesi province. Over 11,000 athletes from 45 nations are expected to participate in Asian Games in Indonesian cities of Jakarta and Palembang from August 18 to September 2.
